We are proud to have such a talented individual like Olivia on #TeamBilirakis & we look forward to seeing her future successes. COVID has limited our intern program in the district & halted it in DC, but we can't wait to invite interns back soon! 
https://t.co/WtIbCpe9fs

‚ÄúAs our economy looks to fully rebound, the travel and tourism sectors provide a great opportunity for American growth and prosperity. We must do everything we can to facilitate a safe return to pre-pandemic levels of employment within this critical industry.‚Äù https://t.co/lqd40MjaCv

Thanks @SteveScalise for this amazing cookie cake to celebrate the passage of my bill HR 4861. This bill provides grants to hospital emergency departments so that they can connect those who are at risk for suicide with mental health services. #mentalhealth https://t.co/j0Ypig5cIy

The STAND-UP Act has a goal to identify threats before they materialize & ensure at-risk students get the mental health treatment they need. These programs reduce bullying, suicide & campus violence. A special thanks to @SandyHookPromise Foundation for its support.

Tomorrow at 4:30pm I will be going live on #Facebook to discuss #OperationWarpSpeed and the continued push to find a safe and effective vaccine to combat #COVID19. Check back later for the announcement on my special guest.
Fast Fact: Before #COVID19, there were 12,202 solar energy jobs in Florida. It is time to get these folks back to work. #NCEW20

Thank you @baycare for inviting me to participate in this  important discussion. As we continue to battle #COVID19, I'm confident in the work being done locally by @baycare, & the incredible job being done by @CMSGov Administrator & @WhiteHouse Task Force Member @SeemaCMS. https://t.co/3Wkek0SoD6

Thanks to a global partnership and the technical leadership of @CDCgov & @USAID, the African
region has officially been certified as wild poliovirus-free. Over 90% of the world‚Äôs population live

Although things are quiet in the halls of Congress, I am continuing to follow the strict guidelines of the #HouseSergeantAtArms & @CDCgov by wearing a face mask and maintaining social distance. We must keep following the guidelines to get back to normal. https://t.co/z3r6c2Sxkf

Earlier today, the Department of Health and Human Services announced that Florida will receive $420,883,713 in CARES Act funding to increase testing capacity.  More testing means improved data-driven decision making.

We continue to face a serious epidemic throughout our nation & despite billions of dollars of investment, patients are still having difficulty accessing care.  There are no magic solutions to this problem, but I will continue to work on good policy to improve access to care.(2/2)

I will keep working to ensure health professionals have the resources they need to keep Americans safe. In the interim, we can all take precautionary measures to prevent the spread of illness, including: regular hand washing, covering coughs & staying home when sick.(2/2)

The most important message from the CDC is that we all need to remain calm.  The CDC is confident that it will be able to avoid a widespread epidemic. (2/3)

Sadly, stigma has enabled the industry to provide worse  coverage for mental health conditions than for other physical ailments, despite being illegal.  Not surprised some oppose the transparency required in my bill; accountability is rarely popular.  https://t.co/ty8h5LbouL

@RSwashe Reauthorizing community health centers for the 27 million  who rely on them, Removing annual cap on therapy in Medicare, Allowing Alt. treatments for Vets, lowering Rx drug costs...are not just feel good measures. They, like all my bills, solve problems and help real people.
